thread.title: Man sets costumes on fire in Walmart
thread.title_full: Man sets costumes on fire in Walmart | www.ajc.com

author: Cox Media Group National Content Desk
title: Man sets costumes on fire in Walmart
text:
Workers at a California Walmart had to act quickly after a man set fire to Halloween costumes for sale at the store.
The man picked up a bottle of charcoal lighter fluid in the gardening section of the store on Tuesday and started spraying it on costumes, KTVI reported.
>> Read more trending stories
Workers grabbed fire extinguishers to put out the flames before they could spread.
One man caught it on video and posted it to his Twitter page.
. @KTVU fire broke out at Walmart store in San Leandro. Fire cause by Halloween costume pic.twitter.com/7Akvg4jbaC
— Paul Miller (@JustPaulMiller) October 13, 2015 More from the scene @KTVU pic.twitter.com/wZmy3dhyxG
— Paul Miller (@JustPaulMiller) October 13, 2015 The man set one aisle of costumes on fire before employees were able to tackle him, holding him until police could arrive, KABC reported.
A pile of burned costumes was seen outside the store after the situation was under control.
Pile of charred #Halloween costumes outside San Leandro #Walmart where man doused them with lighter fluid and lit. pic.twitter.com/UpFa06X1ja
— Laura Anthony (@LauraAnthony7) October 13, 2015 Police did not release a motive.
